Name: lanispl
Description: this is false for internal languages (such as sql) and true for user-defined languages. currently, pg_dump still uses this to determine which languages need to be dumped, but this may be replaced by a different mechanism sometime.

Name: lanpltrusted
Description: this is a trusted language. if this is an internal language (lanispl is false) then this column is meaningless.

Name: lanplcallfoid
Description: for noninternal languages this references the language handler, which is a special function that is responsible for executing all functions that are written in the particular language.

Name: lanvalidator
Description: this references a language validator function that is responsible for checking the syntax and validity of new functions when they are created. zero if no validator is provided.

Name: lanacl
Description: access privileges; see grant and revoke for details.
